title: Upcoming Webinar: Is Extractivism a Prime Cause of  the Polycrisis?
content: Upcoming Webinar: Is Extractivism a Prime Cause of the Polycrisis? albov@helsinki.fi Fri, 30/01/2026 - 14:05 The webinar, full title, "Is Extractivism a Prime Cause of the Polycrisis? title: CEACG's two new PhD projects focus on online gambling
content: CEACG's two new PhD projects focus on online gambling kmette@helsinki.fi Fri, 30/01/2026 - 13:33 New doctoral researchers Paula Rautoja and Mark Tarplee talk about their work and expectations for the upcoming years. Fresh perspectives on digital gambling markets Two new PhD projects will look into the power structures and advertising networks of the online gambling industry, offering sociological insight on how addiction and harms are produced in online environments. content: Aleksi Knuutila is joining HSSH leading the ReliaCode project ajarske@helsinki.fi Fri, 30/01/2026 - 13:08 University researcher Aleksi Knuutila is joining HSSH in February, leading the ReliaCode project. University researcher Aleksi Knuutila is joining HSSH in February. He is leading the ReliaCode project, funded by the Finnish Research Council and Business Finland, studying what kind of infrastructure trustworthy AI requires for analytical workflows in organisational settings. title: Ilja Vuorinne will defend his PhD thesis
content: Ilja Vuorinne will defend his PhD thesis mkulmala@helsinki.fi Thu, 29/01/2026 - 11:40 Ilja Vuorinne will defend his PhD thesis “ Remote sensing applications in vegetation assessment and invasive species detection in semi-arid landscapes of Kenya” on Friday, February 6, 1 pm in the Tekla Hultin (F3003), Main building of the University of Helsinki. Opponent is Associate Professor Michael Marshall, University of Twente, while thesis supervisors have been Janne Heiskanen and Petri Pellikka. Thesis i...

title: FLORAhomage – Aistihavaintojen äärellä
content: FLORAhomage – Art from sensory impressions johanemi@helsinki.fi Fri, 30/01/2026 - 13:06 Jaana Kaipiainen’s exhibition is on view at the Gallery Corridor of the Kaisaniemi Greenhouses from 3 February to 5 April 2026. The paintings in Jaana Kaipiainen’s FLORAhomage are based on sensory impressions evoked in the artist by the plants, light, and scents of the Kaisaniemi Botanic Garden. The works are created intuitively, often painted over existing layers. The paintings also contain subtle hints for ...
creator: johanemi@helsinki.fi

title: Luonnontieteellinen museo suljetaan huoltoviikon ajaksi
content: The Natural History Museum will be closed during the maintenance week johanemi@helsinki.fi Fri, 09/01/2026 - 14:10 The museum will be closed during the maintenance week, Mon–Fri, 12–16 January 2026. The doors will reopen on Saturday, 17 January. The Natural History Museum will be closed during the maintenance week, Mon–Fri, 12–16 January. title: Kotina metsä -näyttely tuo luonnonmetsän keskelle Helsinkiä
content: Forest Home – Exhibition brings a natural forest to the heart of Helsinki johanemi@helsinki.fi Fri, 30/05/2025 - 14:09 In Finland, natural forests have become a rarity – and for many, they remain unfamiliar. The Forest Home exhibition invites visitors to discover them through photography, video installations and scientific specimens. Forest Home is on display at the Natural History Museum until 5 April 2026. Photographic artists Ritva Kovalainen and Sanni Seppo explore the rich life of natural f...
